pageContext.claim: “The Kurds have been fighting with Turkey for a long time. The Kurds are some very good people, some very bad people, some -- if you look at PKK, they are among the -- you know, a tough, tough group of people, let me put it that way. And I didn't fight. I told them, I won't get involved....But Iraq was going to fight the Kurds. And I said, nope, we are not going to take either side, because we had just been fighting for Iraq and now they want to us fight against Iraq and fight for the Kurds -- and you know what, the Kurds left. They never took up the fight.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump mistakenly suggests Iraqi troops fought Kurds in Syria — rather than around the Iraqi city of Kirkuk — indicating a poor understanding of the region. The Iraqi government seized Kirkuk — in Iraq — from the control of fighters affiliated with factions based in the semiautonomous Iraqi region of Kurdistan.
